content.text: What makes a document 'good' depends on who is asking, where they are, and why they are searching. This is 'Context'.
content.hook: Searching for 'Pizza' at 12 PM in Italy means something different than at 12 AM in New York.

content.text: 1. Spatial: Location (GPS/IP). 2. Temporal: Time (Latest news vs History). 3. Linguistic: Preceding queries (Ambiguity resolver). 4. Social: What similar people like.
content.hook: Context turns a string of characters into a specific intent.

content.text: How systems learn what is good. 1. Explicit Feedback: Users marking results. 2. Implicit Feedback: Click-through rate, dwell time, bookmarking, purchasing.
content.hook: Implicit signals are the goldmine of modern search engines.

formula.description: The Rocchio Algorithm is the classic method for implementing relevance feedback by adjusting the query vector towards relevant documents and away from non-relevant ones.

terms.meaning: Modified Query vector - the improved query after feedback
Original Query vector - the user's initial search
